## âœ… Step 4: Dev.to Article (10 minutes)

Go to https://dev.to/new

**Title:** "I Built and Published My First NPM Package: agents-templated"

**Tags:** npm, javascript, opensource, devtools

**Body:**
```markdown
# I Built My First NPM Package: agents-templated

## The Problem

Every time I started a new project, I spent 2-3 hours on:
- Setting up project structure
- Configuring AI assistants (Cursor, Copilot)
- Implementing security patterns
- Setting up testing strategies

And it was different for every tech stack! ğŸ˜¤

## The Solution

I built **agents-templated** - a CLI tool that does all of this in 30 seconds.

\`\`\`bash
npm install -g agents-templated
agents-templated init --all
\`\`\`

## Key Features

âœ… **Technology-Agnostic** - Works with React, Vue, Python, Go, ANY stack
âœ… **AI-Ready** - Pre-configured for Cursor & GitHub Copilot
âœ… **Security-First** - OWASP Top 10 patterns built-in
âœ… **Selective Installation** - Only install what you need

## How It Works

\`\`\`bash
# Install globally
npm install -g agents-templated

# Navigate to your project
cd my-project

# Install everything
agents-templated init --all

# Or install selectively
agents-templated init --docs --rules
agents-templated init --github
\`\`\`

You get:
- AGENTS.MD (development patterns)
- CLAUDE.md (project guidelines)
- AI_INSTRUCTIONS.md (AI assistant setup)
- agents/rules/ (6 development rule files)
- agents/skills/ (reusable agent skills)
- .github/copilot-instructions.md (GitHub Copilot config)

## What I Learned

Building this taught me:
- **Node.js CLI development** with Commander.js
- **NPM publishing workflow** (including 2FA!)
- **User experience design** for developer tools
- **Open source best practices**

## Try It!

ğŸ”— **NPM:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/agents-templated
ğŸ”— **GitHub:** https://github.com/rickandrew2/agents-projects-templated

I'd love your feedback! What features would you like to see?

---

*Have you ever built an npm package? What was your experience? Let me know in the comments!* ğŸ‘‡
```

Click **"Publish"**

## ğŸ“± Social Media Tips

### LinkedIn:
- Post between 8-10 AM on Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday
- Use 3-5 relevant hashtags
- Reply to EVERY comment
- Share as a "Celebrating" post for more visibility

### Twitter:
- Post between 12-3 PM
- Use 3-4 hashtags max
- Include a GIF or screenshot for more engagement
- Retweet positive feedback

### Dev.to:
- Respond to all comments within 24 hours
- Add relevant tags
- Share your article on Twitter/LinkedIn
- Engage with other articles in the same tags
